name: Recipe - Food - Nutrition
description:
The spoonacular Nutrition, Recipe, and Food API allows you to access over 365,000 recipes and 86,000 food products. Our food ontology and semantic recipe search engine makes it possible to search for recipes using natural language queries, such as "gluten free brownies without sugar" or "low fat vegan cupcakes." You can automatically calculate the nutritional information for any recipe, analyze recipe costs, visualize ingredient lists, find recipes for what's in your fridge, find recipes based on special diets, nutritional requirements, or favorite ingredients, classify recipes into types and cuisines, convert ingredient amounts, or even compute an entire meal plan. With our powerful API, you can create many kinds of food and especially nutrition apps.

Special diets/dietary requirements currently available include: vegan, vegetarian, pescetarian, gluten free, grain free, dairy free, high protein, low sodium, low carb, Paleo, Primal, ketogenic, FODMAP, and Whole 30. We will soon be adding Weight Watcher points, too.

api_methods.name: Create Recipe Card (Deprecated)
api_methods.description: Create a recipe card given a recipe.

parameters.name: backgroundImage
parameters.description: The background image ("none","background1", or "background2").

parameters.name: readyInMinutes
parameters.description: The number of minutes it takes to get the recipe on the table.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the recipe.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: The binary image of the recipe as jpg.

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description: The mask to put over the recipe image ("ellipseMask", "diamondMask", "diamondMask", "starMask", "heartMask", "potMask", "fishMask").

parameters.name: instructions
parameters.description: The instructions to make the recipe. One step per line.

parameters.name: ingredients
parameters.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

parameters.name: servings
parameters.description: The number of servings that you can make from the ingredients.

parameters.name: fontColor
parameters.description: The font color on the recipe card as a hex-string.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The source of the recipe.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: The author of the recipe.

parameters.name: backgroundColor
parameters.description: The background color on the recipe card as a hex-string.

utterances.utterance: Create a recipe card for a quick 30-minute spaghetti with tomato sauce using background2 and a heart mask.

parameters.title: Spaghetti with Tomato Sauce
parameters.instructions:
Boil pasta
Prepare sauce
Mix together
parameters.ingredients:
200g spaghetti
100g tomato sauce
Salt to taste

parameters.ingredients:

2 tbsp curry powder
200ml coconut milk

parameters.title: Beef Stew

api_methods.name: Recipe Nutrition Widget
api_methods.description:
Visualize a recipe's nutritional information as HTML including CSS. 

Full example code of how to work with widgets can be found in our [spoonacular-widget GitHub](https://github.com/ddsky/spoonacular-widgets).

parameters.name: servings
parameters.description: The number of servings.

parameters.name: ingredientList
parameters.description: The ingredient list of the recipe, one ingredient per line.

parameters.name: showBacklink
parameters.description: Whether to show a backlink to spoonacular.

parameters.name: defaultCss
parameters.description: Whether the default CSS should be added to the response.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The input language, either "en" or "de".

utterances.utterance: Can you show me the nutritional information for a recipe with 4 servings using 2 cups of rice, 1 cup of beans, and 1 tablespoon of olive oil?

parameters.ingredientList:
2 cups of rice
1 cup of beans
1 tablespoon of olive oil

parameters.ingredientList:
200g chicken breast
100g broccoli
50g cheese

api_methods.name: Detect Food in Text
api_methods.description: Detect ingredients and dishes in texts.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text in which food items such as dish names and ingredients should be detected in.
parameters.default: I like to eat delicious tacos. Only cheeseburger with cheddar are better than that. But then again, pizza with pepperoni, mushrooms, and tomatoes is so good!

utterances.utterance: Can you identify the food items in this text: 'I had a delicious breakfast with scrambled eggs, bacon, and toast.'?

parameters.text: I had a delicious breakfast with scrambled eggs, bacon, and toast.

utterances.utterance: What ingredients can you find in the sentence: 'For dinner, I made a salad with lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, and feta cheese.'?

parameters.text: For dinner, I made a salad with lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, and feta cheese.

utterances.utterance: Detect the dishes mentioned in this text: 'My favorite meals are spaghetti carbonara and chicken curry.'

parameters.text: My favorite meals are spaghetti carbonara and chicken curry.

utterances.utterance: Identify the food items in: 'I love snacking on almonds, cashews, and dried apricots.'

parameters.text: I love snacking on almonds, cashews, and dried apricots.

utterances.utterance: What food items are mentioned in: 'For lunch, I had a turkey sandwich with avocado and a side of coleslaw.'?

parameters.text: For lunch, I had a turkey sandwich with avocado and a side of coleslaw.

utterances.utterance: Can you find the ingredients in this text: 'The smoothie was made with bananas, strawberries, and almond milk.'?

parameters.text: The smoothie was made with bananas, strawberries, and almond milk.

utterances.utterance: What dishes are mentioned in: 'I enjoy eating sushi rolls and miso soup for dinner.'?

parameters.text: I enjoy eating sushi rolls and miso soup for dinner.

utterances.utterance: Detect the food items in: 'For dessert, I had a slice of chocolate cake and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.'

parameters.text: For dessert, I had a slice of chocolate cake and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

utterances.utterance: Identify the ingredients in: 'The pasta sauce was made with garlic, onions, and crushed tomatoes.'

parameters.text: The pasta sauce was made with garlic, onions, and crushed tomatoes.

utterances.utterance: What food items can you find in: 'I like to start my day with oatmeal topped with blueberries and honey.'?

parameters.text: I like to start my day with oatmeal topped with blueberries and honey.

api_methods.name: Analyze Recipe
api_methods.description: This endpoint allows you to send raw recipe information, such as title, servings, and ingredients, to then see what we compute (badges, diets, nutrition, and more). This is useful if you have your own recipe data and want to enrich it with our semantic analysis.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The input language, either \\\"en\\\" or \\\"de\\\".

utterances.utterance: Can you analyze this recipe for chocolate cake and include the nutritional information?
Please analyze my pasta recipe and include taste details.
Analyze this vegan salad recipe and provide both taste and nutrition information.
Can you analyze my German apple pie recipe?
I need a nutritional analysis for my homemade granola recipe.
Could you analyze this smoothie recipe and include taste details?
Please analyze my recipe for chicken curry and provide nutritional information.
Can you analyze this recipe for lasagna and include both taste and nutrition details?
Analyze my recipe for French onion soup.
I need a taste analysis for my chocolate chip cookies recipe.

api_methods.name: Connect User
api_methods.description:
In order to call user-specific endpoints, you need to connect your app's users to spoonacular users.

Just call this endpoint with your user's information and you will get back a username and hash that you must save on your side. In future requests that you make on this user's behalf you simply pass their username and hash alongside your API key.
